exercises.title: 4-7-8 Breathing
exercises.description: A simple breathing technique to reduce anxiety and promote relaxation. Perfect for beginners.
steps: Find a comfortable seated position with your back straight
Place the tip of your tongue against the ridge behind your upper teeth
Exhale completely through your mouth, making a whoosh sound
Close your mouth and inhale quietly through your nose for 4 counts
Hold your breath for 7 counts
Exhale through your mouth for 8 counts, making a whoosh sound
Repeat this cycle 3-4 times

exercises.title: Box Breathing
exercises.description: A structured breathing pattern used by Navy SEALs to maintain calm under pressure.
steps: Sit comfortably with your feet flat on the floor
Exhale all air from your lungs
Inhale through your nose for 4 counts
Hold your breath for 4 counts
Exhale through your mouth for 4 counts
Hold empty for 4 counts
Repeat for 4-8 cycles
Return to normal breathing

exercises.title: Body Scan Meditation
exercises.description: A mindfulness practice that helps you connect with your body and release tension.
steps: Lie down comfortably on your back
Close your eyes and take three deep breaths
Start by focusing on your toes, notice any sensations
Slowly move your attention up through your feet and ankles
Continue scanning up through your legs, pelvis, and torso
Notice your arms, hands, and fingers
Move to your neck, face, and head
Take a moment to feel your whole body
Wiggle your fingers and toes before opening your eyes

exercises.title: Mindful Walking
exercises.description: Practice mindfulness while walking, perfect for outdoor meditation or when you need to move.
steps: Find a quiet path or space where you can walk slowly
Begin walking at a slower pace than usual
Focus on the sensation of your feet touching the ground
Notice the movement of your legs and the swing of your arms
Pay attention to your surroundings without judgment
If your mind wanders, gently return focus to walking
Feel the rhythm of your steps
End by standing still for a moment before continuing your day

exercises.title: Progressive Muscle Relaxation
exercises.description: Systematically tense and relax muscle groups to release physical stress and tension.
steps: Lie down or sit comfortably in a quiet space
Start with your toes - tense them for 5 seconds, then relax
Move to your calves - tense and release
Continue with your thighs, glutes, and abdomen
Tense and relax your hands, arms, and shoulders
Scrunch your facial muscles, then release
Take a moment to notice the contrast between tension and relaxation
Breathe deeply and enjoy the feeling of complete relaxation

exercises.title: 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding
exercises.description: A grounding technique that uses your senses to bring you back to the present moment.
steps: Sit comfortably and take a deep breath
Look around and name 5 things you can see
Notice 4 things you can touch or feel
Listen for 3 things you can hear
Identify 2 things you can smell
Notice 1 thing you can taste
Take three more deep breaths
Notice how you feel more present and grounded

exercises.title: Sleep Preparation
exercises.description: A calming routine to prepare your mind and body for restful sleep.
steps: Lie down in your bed in a comfortable position
Close your eyes and take five deep, slow breaths
Starting from your toes, consciously relax each part of your body
Imagine a warm, golden light moving up from your feet
Let this light dissolve any tension as it moves through your body
Focus on your breathing, letting it become slower and deeper
If thoughts arise, acknowledge them and let them drift away
Continue breathing slowly until you drift off to sleep

exercises.title: Counting Meditation
exercises.description: A simple counting technique to quiet the mind and promote sleep.
steps: Get comfortable in your bed and close your eyes
Begin counting backwards from 100
With each number, take a slow, deep breath
Visualize each number in your mind
If you lose count, simply start over from 100
Don't worry about reaching zero
Let the counting become automatic and soothing
Allow yourself to drift off whenever you feel ready
